page.title: 19WIVELISCOMBE RECREATION GRND
page.content: The Recreation Ground "Broad Meadows" was paid for by public subscription in memory of the fallen in the 1914-18 war. There is a tin of contemporary relics buried under the memorial. Founded in 1870, Wiveliscombe {Cricket}Club is a flourishing club, playing its home matches on Wiveliscombe Recreation Ground. Dating back to 1872, Wiveliscombe {Rugby}Club was founded largely by the Hancock family. It has fielded teams continually since then, apart from during the two wars.The Club has a modern clubhouse,which caters for many of the social needs of the town. Since 1923,there has been a Wiveliscombe{Tennis}Club. There are now three all-weather courts. The open-air{swimming}pool,opened in 1927, gives summertime pleasure.
